Sarah Carter.Action: Shows hesitation and uncertainty about tackling the dangerous rapids ahead.
Identifies the final challenge ahead ('the meat-grinder') and attempts to slow down by back-paddling, showing awareness and caution.
Laughs hysterically with others after a dangerous experience, shares a playful moment by pushing Juno into the water, displays friendly and sincere interaction with companions.
Turns and hurries off alone after bidding others to continue and assuring them they will see them later, possibly avoiding staying with group.
Screams out to warn about the impending crash.
Turns and hurries off confidently after Paul and Jessica to keep up.
Lying broken and bruised in intensive care after the crash.
Clings to Beth for support when frightened and disoriented.
Clings to Beth for support as a quivering wreck.
Stares blankly and seems oblivious to surroundings for a prolonged time.
Straightens up, pulls herself together to support Beth emotionally.
Expresses reluctance to be the one to tell Juno bad news, showing consideration for others' feelings.
Stares awake in bed, glassy-eyed and unable to sleep.
Gets up to look out the window despite apparent distress.
Presses her head against the window to ease a pounding headache.
Is suddenly and violently attacked by a scaffolding pole smashing through the window and hitting her head.
Swallows pills grimacing, appears physically struggling but continues with the group.
Looks distracted and distant during group interactions, silent and not engaging with others.
Successfully descends the cave rope and lands safely near the bottom without incident.
Expresses amazement and awe at the cave environment.
Warns Rebecca 'All clear!' after descent, indicating attentiveness to group safety.
Shows concern and curiosity by investigating the bird’s nest and alerting others, signaling care and engagement with the environment and group.
Appears panicky when suddenly swarmed by bats, requiring Juno to rescue her.
Signals 'All clear' to Rebecca, showing awareness and communication during the descent.
Notices recent scratch marks and a chirping noise, investigates carefully with her torchbeam.
Approaches the hole in the cave wall anticipating a potential discovery, indicating curiosity and attentiveness.
Panics when bats swarm out of the hole, needing to be pulled clear by Juno.
Responds softly and shares a moment of quiet understanding with Juno about their mutual losses.
Admits to being 'a bit out of it' and quietly excuses herself to look around alone.
Reassures Juno confidently by saying 'I won’t break.'
Acknowledges emotional difficulty softly but maintains composure.
Admits being 'a bit out of it,' possibly due to jet-lag.
Decides independently to explore the cave to find a way through.
Leaves the group despite caution from others to not go too far.
Moves to explore the cave on her own, shows curiosity and attentiveness by investigating sounds and surroundings.
Suddenly appears at Juno’s shoulder to inform her about finding a way, showing engagement and helpfulness.
Picks up her torch and explores the cave cautiously, investigates noises attentively and finds a way forward.
Appears suddenly and startles Juno.
Volunteers to wait for Sam instead of rushing into exploring the fissure, demonstrating patience and responsibility.
Does not take lead or try to guide the group into the fissure, defers to others like Holly and Juno who take point and manage rope safety.
Continues moving forward despite extreme discomfort in claustrophobic environment
Expresses panic and desperation when stuck but communicates clearly by responding to Beth's concern
Attempts to persevere through a very claustrophobic and difficult environment despite discomfort and fear.
Gets stuck in a narrow passage and panics, unable to free herself from a tight situation.
Panics and struggles while trapped, unable to calm down despite others' efforts.
Complies with Beth's request and crawls slowly toward her despite fear and the cave's danger.
Glances backward with horror but continues to move forward to escape danger, trusting Beth's guidance.
Carefully attaches safety line to pitons while performing a physically demanding and dangerous crossing, showing stamina, skill, and attention to safety.
Takes time to disguise the old piton by hooking a carabina to it, indicating strategic thinking to avoid raising concerns in the team.
Looks back at Juno crossing in dreamlike slow motion, showing concern.
Receives the old piton and carabiner from Juno and questions its meaning, engaging with group curiosity.
Notices faint noise others miss, cautiously investigates potential danger despite warnings.
Ignores direct request to not wander off from Juno.
Hears Holly's scream of agony but continues exploring deeper into the tunnels without responding or checking on her.
Shares her anxious observation about seeing a man in the tunnel despite skepticism from others.
Quietly defends her sighting when others doubt her, indicating sincerity.
Hands JUNO the helmet without confrontation after being questioned.
Encourages and is supported by others despite their doubt; tries to help Holly by using her camcorder to investigate the area with infrared.
Points out earlier that they are not alone, showing awareness and vigilance.
Alerts Juno about the flare possibly revealing their location, demonstrating situational awareness and tactical thinking.
Wakes up scared and disoriented but quickly assesses her surroundings using the camcorder, showing calmness and resourcefulness.
Reacts with shock and horror at seeing Holly's corpse, indicating emotional sensitivity and empathy.
Closes her eyes and gags while watching the CRAWLERS tear apart Holly's corpse, freezes and cowers in fear.
Remains silent and composed despite hearing her friend being torn apart nearby, resisting the urge to give herself away.
Carefully pulls the makeshift splint from Holly's leg despite the grisly and gruesome surroundings, showing calmness and precision.
Hears the cry of the CRAWLER, stops and listens carefully, waiting to assess the situation.
After hearing the cry, she feels a shiver but then moves on feeling more confident, carrying a burning torch.
Feeling more confident, moves on carrying her burning torch through the lair despite nervousness.
Scans the lair carefully with a torch, actively searching for Beth.
Despite stumbling and falling, quickly recovers and investigates her surroundings, revealing the body of Beth.
Cradles Beth’s body and tries to help her, showing emotional intelligence and care.
Expresses shock and distress openly when seeing Beth’s condition.
Despite Beth's warnings about Juno, Sarah insists on trusting Juno, potentially ignoring critical caution.
Takes the whistle from Beth with tears streaming down her face and honors Beth by wearing it as she did.
Mercifully ends Beth's suffering by euthanizing her as requested, showing compassion in a dire situation.
Appears trance-like and blank after Beth coughs up blood, indicating emotional overwhelm but no visible supportive action in that moment.
Takes the whistle from Beth and places it around her neck, symbolizing acceptance of responsibility.
Mercifully kills Beth quickly and smoothly with a jagged rock, showing decisiveness and emotional control under pressure.
Snaps out of a trance to focus on the immediate threat as she grabs torch and scans for danger.
Uses a sharp rib bone skillfully as a weapon to blind and kill a Crawler underwater, persevering despite exhaustion.
Remains absolutely still and calm while a second Crawler sniffs near her, showing patience and control under pressure.
Carefully and slowly reaches for a massive elk thigh bone as a weapon during a tense moment.
Strikes the Crawler repeatedly with the thigh bone in a rage-blinded state but successfully kills it.
Slumps down drained after the fight, showing vulnerability but no signs of poor decision-making.
Shows steely resolve and determination while enduring unbearable pain to cross a dangerous gorge using climbing skills and safety equipment.
Ignores warnings from others to turn back despite the obvious danger.
Reaches out to save Juno from drowning and pulls her out of the water despite her own battered and bloody state.
Remains silent and avoids explaining or comforting Juno about the blood and the killings she is implicated in.
Leads Juno decisively and confidently up past the waterfall and into the fissure, taking charge of the situation.
Finds Beth’s pick and thoughtfully swaps it for her own bone, showing presence of mind and practical skill.
Carefully peers around the corner and assesses the passage as clear before moving forward, demonstrating caution combined with confidence.
Remains silent and only half-turns to leave after hearing about Beth’s death, which could be interpreted as emotional detachment or difficulty processing the news.
Lets out a fearful, guttural roar of defiance to protect her friend, keeps multiple attackers at bay with the firebrand, fights fiercely alongside Juno against the crawlers.
Lets out a fearful roar of defiance but uses the firebrand skillfully to keep multiple attackers at bay, thrusting and waving it to defend herself.
Despite fighting fiercely and landing a kick and smashing her pick into an attacker, she gets outwitted by the other attackers, who surround her and knock the firebrand away, causing her to fall.
Fights fiercely alongside Juno, showing determination and mutual defense against attackers.
Locks eyes with Juno after the fight, sharing a moment of understanding and unspoken communication about a past accident.
Sarcastic retort to Juno's reassurance ('Cross your heart and hope to die?').
Deliberately kills Juno with no sign of remorse and escapes without looking back
Claws her way up the mountain of bones with extreme effort despite physical and mental strain.
Runs wildly and desperately through the forest toward help.
Drives the 4x4 with absolute resolve and determination to escape danger.
Breaks down emotionally, showing vulnerability and the weight of sorrow, remorse, and guilt.
Slumps onto the steering wheel, struggling inwardly with complex emotions but trying to gather composure.
Fires up the 4x4, maneuvers it at speed through dangerous terrain with resolve and skill, successfully reaching a safer road.
Eventually becomes emotionally overwhelmed, loses control of the vehicle, and stops abruptly on the highway.
Takes a deep breath and confidently signals readiness to face the difficult white water rafting challenge.
Struggles alongside BETH against the strong current and rocky terrain but manages to emerge safely from the ‘Meat-Grinder’ section.
Joins in lighthearted behavior and laughter after the ordeal, showing emotional resilience.
Decides pragmatically to leave first and follow PAUL and JESSICA back to the car, indicating confidence in managing the group’s movements.
Stares blankly, quivering and unable to fathom reality outside the hospital room.
Sits silently and stares obliviously out of the car window, startled by an overhanging branch.
Straightens up, pulls herself together, and confidently asserts that she won’t be the one to tell Juno.
Says 'Beth... it's no-one's fault' to defuse tension.
Greets Juno warmly and accepts her embrace.
Embraces Sam and responds positively to friendly gestures.
Thanks Sam sincerely for his letter, showing appreciation.
Stares distractedly into the fire, not engaging with Juno when invited to help.
Jokes with Holly about her base jumping, contributing to lightening the mood and laughter.
Shares a deeply personal and tragic experience about her child dying a year ago, calmly and sincerely.
Responds attentively to others' personal relationship updates, engaging in friendly conversation.
Accepts Rebecca squeezing her hand in a moment of awkward silence, showing openness to comfort.
Calmly reveals a deeply personal and painful experience to the group, showing emotional control and trust.
Initiates conversation, asks thoughtful questions about others' lives and relationships.
Responds quietly and does not interrupt despite the heavy atmosphere after her revelation.
Knocks back some pills and grimaces, indicating possible discomfort or impaired condition.
Is distractedly looking out the window, vision slightly blurred, showing inattentiveness and lack of focus during a bumpy ride.
Looks upwards to confirm if the BATS are gone after Juno says so, showing caution and verification.
Asks Sam how she is feeling to check on team members’ condition, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Calms down despite fear and follows Beth’s instructions to crawl slowly toward safety.
Uses her feet against the wall to push herself the last distance out of the fissure, showing physical effort and determination.
Freezes in horror when the cave ceiling drops after she kicks away some rock, hesitating before moving.
Glances back into darkness during the dangerous escape instead of focusing solely forward, showing awareness of surroundings under stress.
Comes around coughing and accepts help from Rebecca, acknowledges being alright despite shock.
Distances herself from the group and stares alone into the darkness during crisis moment.
Comes around and reassures others she is alright despite being shocked and coughing from a collapse.
Distances herself from the group and stares alone into the darkness rather than participating in the group discussion or planning.
Stands apart from the others, staring into the darkness, hesitates to speak about her concerns and dismisses her own doubts with 'Never mind... it’s nothing...'.
Quickly examines the old piton and the carabiner handed to her and asks about their meaning, showing situational awareness and curiosity.
Stands behind Beth, looking into the cleft in slow motion and seemingly dreamlike, indicating possible distraction or detachment in a critical moment.
Does not take lead or speak in the scene, shows no decisive action or input while others explore and react.
No mention or appearance of Sarah Carter in the excerpt; no actions or behaviors to evaluate.
Reaches the edge quickly to witness Holly’s fall, showing alertness and prompt arrival at the crisis scene.
Does not take an immediate action to assist Holly or help secure the area after the fall, mostly observing the situation.
Arrives promptly at the injury scene and assists with the rescue effort.
Has no spoken lines or independent actions; mostly follows directions without initiating.
Insists she saw someone despite others doubting her, showing confidence in her observation.
Uses Holly's camcorder with infrared to scan the area, demonstrating resourcefulness and technical skill.
Carefully observes and identifies details in the cave (shredded clothing, absence of bodies), showing attention to detail and analytical ability.
Leads the way fleeing the scene but abandons Beth who stumbles and falls.
Leads the way while fleeing the dangerous scene, keeping ahead of the group.
Leaves Beth behind after she stumbles and falls, abandoning her in a critical moment.
Runs blindly in the darkness, unaware of the precipice, and falls hitting her head with no apparent control.
Wakes up disoriented but quickly activates an old mining lamp and uses the camcorder’s infrared viewfinder to assess the horrifying environment.
Backs quickly into the darkest shadows upon hearing noises from above, showing situational awareness and caution.
Fails to keep track of her own equipment; helmet lamp is smashed and torch is missing when she wakes.
Holds her breath and remains perfectly still as the CRAWLER watches her closely, avoiding detection despite the danger.
Becomes trapped when the CRAWLER turns back its attention to the main course, unable to escape or act further.
Carefully emerges from shadows and approaches Holly’s remains, apologizes sincerely.
Pulls the pick handle free from Holly’s leg splint despite gruesome conditions.
Carefully removes the makeshift splint from Holly's bloody, injured leg despite the grisly and unpleasant task.
Lifts Holly’s upper body and removes her outer clothing to assess or treat injury despite the awkward and icky nature of the work.
Lights a makeshift torch to provide light in the dangerous environment, showing care and resourcefulness to improve the situation.
Carefully removes the makeshift splint from Holly’s leg despite the grisly, bloody conditions.
Skillfully manages the tricky and awkward task of removing Holly’s outer clothing.
Creates a makeshift torch by wrapping clothing around the pick handle, dousing it in oil, and lighting it, providing light in a dark, dangerous environment.
Moves deeper into the lair carefully, showing cautious awareness and preparedness in a hostile environment.
Cradles Beth's injured body and tries to comfort her despite Beth’s hostility.
Insists that Juno is their friend and should be trusted despite Beth's warnings.
Fights desperately for survival against the Crawler, using whatever means necessary including a rib bone as a weapon.
Appears to be overwhelmed by the situation and is presumed dead by others.
Leads Juno cautiously and decisively through dangerous terrain, showing concern for safety and survival.
Remains silent and detached upon hearing about Beth's death, showing little outward compassion.
Huddles up, rocking back and forth, lost to darkness and delusional, drawn into fading firebrand for comfort.
